channel.title: Blank interface/quest interface change and custom items
channel.description: I made my quest interface 17000 and now its a blank interface.Now, I want to change the blank interface and add stuff into it.Or even better, if somebody knows how can i change the original quest interface...? Also, how can I add custom items?Its an 317 pi. Here is the link where I downloaded it from:http://tinyurl.com/7xo5s9y

item.title: Blank interface/quest interface change and custom items
item.dc:creator: @Vukiii Vukiii
item.description:
@Vukiii wrote:

Well I wanted to edit the interface and add text and stuff into it, but I dont know where can I do that.Also if I should use the lins interface editor could you link me to it and give me a tut?Since I cant find it.

Read full topic
item.source: Blank interface/quest interface change and custom items

item.title: Blank interface/quest interface change and custom items
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Use frame126 to build onto interfaces.

If you want to edit the actual interface you have several options.

Cache packed or through frame126 once-more.

If you’re going to edit the cache, you’ll need tom’s cache suite and lin’s interface editor (there are other programs, those are the ones I prefer). You’ll open up the quest interface which is interface 638. Then you can modify any/all strings from there through Lin’s easy-to-use UI. Repack the cache and off you go.

If you’re going to edit the strings via code, you’ll need to gather a list of string ID’s (which I can dump here). From there you’ll have to add in sendFrame126("", interfaceId); with the new text of your choosing. Remember that you’re working with layers.

638:638, null, null, null, null, null, null, [Action List:], interface type:0
639:638, null, null, null, null, null, null, [Action List:], interface type:0
640:638, Quest Journal, null, null, null, , null, [Action List:], interface type:4
